security_audit.summary: Low-risk utility skill for memory management. All capabilities match stated purpose. Filesystem access is limited to .claude/ directory for memory files. Bash tool is used only for backup file operations. No network calls or environment variable access detected.

content.user_title: Manage project memory and SSOT files
content.value_statement: AI assistants lose context between sessions. This skill initializes and maintains Single Source of Truth files so every session starts with consistent project knowledge, decisions, and task tracking.
actual_capabilities: Initialize decisions.md, patterns.md, and session-log.md in .claude/memory/
Merge Plans.md while preserving all user tasks across sessions
Migrate AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md, and Plans.md to new formats with user approval
Create automatic backups before making changes to workflow files
Extract and reorganize project-specific rules during migration
limitations: Does not modify source code or implementation files
Does not execute arbitrary commands beyond file operations
Does not access network resources or external APIs
Does not read environment variables or credentials

use_cases.title: Set up project memory
use_cases.description: Initialize SSOT files for a new project so all team members and AI assistants have consistent context

use_cases.title: Preserve task history
use_cases.description: Merge Plans.md updates without losing task progress across multiple work sessions

use_cases.title: Migrate workflow configs
use_cases.description: Update existing workflow files to new formats while keeping important rules and task data intact

prompt_templates.title: Initialize memory
prompt_templates.prompt: Initialize the project memory SSOT files using the memory skill. Create decisions.md, patterns.md, and session-log.md in .claude/memory/ if they do not exist.

prompt_templates.title: Merge task list
prompt_templates.prompt: Use merge-plans to update Plans.md. Preserve all existing tasks in the WIP, TODO, done, and archive sections while updating the template structure.

prompt_templates.title: Migrate workflow files
prompt_templates.prompt: Migrate our existing AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md, and Plans.md to the new format. Show me the current content first and confirm before making any changes.

prompt_templates.title: Backup and migrate
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me migrate our workflow files to the new format. Create backups first in .claude-code-harness/backups/, then show me the diff before I approve the changes.

output_examples.input: Initialize project memory and merge Plans.md
output: Initialized memory files in .claude/memory/: decisions.md, patterns.md, session-log.md
Tasks preserved: 3 WIP, 5 TODO, 12 done, 2 archived

best_practices: Initialize memory SSOT before starting work on a new project
Use merge-plans instead of manually editing Plans.md to prevent task loss
Always review diffs before approving migration changes
anti_patterns: Manually editing Plans.md without using merge-plans (risks task loss)
Skipping backups before migrating workflow files
Loading this skill for implementation or code review tasks

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude Code, Claude, and Codex. It is optimized for Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: What is the maximum Plans.md size?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit. The merge algorithm handles files of any size efficiently.

faq.question: Does this integrate with version control?
faq.answer: Memory files are designed to be committed to git. Session logs should remain local.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All operations create backups first. No data is sent externally. All file access is within .claude/ directories.

faq.question: Why is Plans.md not merging correctly?

faq.question: How is this different from context management?
faq.answer: Memory SSOT provides persistent context that survives sessions. Context management handles the current session only.
